The Northern Ireland Assembly

Latest

The Brexit Brief includes our newsletter which provides a summary of all things Brexit over the last month. You can also find information on Brexit and devolution, parliamentary inquiries on EU exit related issues and other useful resources.

Explore the Brexit Brief...

News

Press Release: Young Women Bring 'Balance for Better' Message to the Assembly

Lighting of Parliament Buildings:  Parliament Buildings will be illuminated in purple on the evening of Friday 8 March to mark International Women’s Day.

Research Matters: Research Matters is a blog produced by the Assembly's Research and Information Service (RaISE). It provides short, topical articles on a wide range of topics affecting Northern Ireland today such as Brexit, the economy, health, education and the environment. Explore the blog...

Latest Videos

View videos

Pictures from the Assembly

See more

Assembly Business

The Northern Ireland Assembly is the devolved legislature for Northern Ireland. It is responsible for making laws on transferred matters in Northern Ireland and for scrutinising the work of Ministers and Government Departments.

  • Committees
  • Legislation
  • Official Report (Hansard)
  • Questions For Answer
  • Research and Information Service (RaISe)
  • Statutory Rules and Papers Laid and Presented

Knowledge Exchange Seminar Series

“Promoting evidence-led policy and law-making within Northern Ireland”. The seventh series of KESS Seminars is currently underway. All seminars are free and are held on Wednesdays from October 2017 through June 2018. Each seminar starts at 1.30pm in Parliament Buildings.

  • 2017-18 KESS Programme

Visit

The Northern Ireland Assembly sits in Parliament Buildings and is open to all members of the public. You can attend debates and watch committee hearings or tour Parliament Buildings. Find out more...

  • Visiting
  • Tours
  • Online Tour
  • The Members' Dining Room
